item.title: DragonScape 525 client
item.dc:creator: @kidscape kidscape
item.description:
@kidscape wrote:

o.O open the cmd or bat…and then edit the “java” to the path of your java.exe “C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin\java.exe” like this…-.-

Read full topic

item.title: DragonScape 525 client
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“h4x0r88, post:4, topic:290259”][quote author=bacnluvr4eva link=topic=383704.msg2880192#msg2880192 date=1248293713]
im having a problem with all of the clients that i download… when i click run or voule or something like that, the command prompt comes up with this:

‘java’ is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.
Press any key to continue . . .

please help!!! i want to use clients
[/quote] that has nothing to do with the client i think your fucked cuz iv tryed too fix it on like 9 computors and everytime i had to reinstall windows to run the java files.
but what you have there is a fuckup system 32 install i have no idea how to fix it but u might want to ask SUN’s customer service.[/quote]

Are you retarded? It means your classpath variables aren’t set correctly.

Read full topic

item.title: DragonScape 525 client
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

You need to add the Server into that small notepad file that says “Servers” Copy the one above it or just rename it to you’re Ip, dont change anything else but the Ip
